criteria: Distinguishing Between Communicable and Non-Communicable Diseases
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of communicable diseases; unable to define or provide examples.
Student demonstrates a very limited understanding of communicable diseases; provides a vague definition or an incorrect example.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of communicable diseases; provides a general definition and a simple example, but lacks depth.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of communicable diseases; provides a clear definition and relevant examples.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of communicable diseases; provides a detailed definition, multiple relevant examples, and explains modes of transmission.
Student demonstrates an exceptional understanding of communicable diseases; provides a comprehensive definition, diverse examples, explains transmission, and discusses prevention strategies.
Student demonstrates no understanding of non-communicable diseases; unable to define or provide examples.
Student demonstrates a very limited understanding of non-communicable diseases; provides a vague definition or an incorrect example.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of non-communicable diseases; provides a general definition and a simple example, but lacks depth.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of non-communicable diseases; provides a clear definition and relevant examples.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of non-communicable diseases; provides a detailed definition, multiple relevant examples, and explains risk factors.

Student demonstrates an exceptional understanding of non-communicable diseases; provides a comprehensive definition, diverse examples, explains risk factors, and discusses management and prevention strategies.
Student is unable to differentiate between communicable and non-communicable diseases; shows no understanding of the key differences.
Student demonstrates difficulty distinguishing between communicable and non-communicable diseases; provides inaccurate or confused explanations.
Student identifies some differences between communicable and non-communicable diseases, but explanations are superficial or incomplete.
Student clearly distinguishes between communicable and non-communicable diseases; provides accurate explanations of the key differences.
Student thoroughly distinguishes between communicable and non-communicable diseases; explains the differences in terms of causes, transmission, and prevention.
Student expertly distinguishes between communicable and non-communicable diseases; provides insightful explanations of the differences, including epidemiological and societal impacts.
